page.title: 18MIDDLETON CIVIC ASSOCIATION
page.content: Middleton Civic Association was founded in 1974 on the reorganisation of local government to "promote, stimulate and continue the social life of the Town of Middleton". The local press commented "Without such a body Middleton can so easily descend into a mere parochial limb of the massive 200,000 population body centred on the former Rochdale Borough. The association has loyally carried out these functions and arranged annual events to maintain traditions of the community. It is particularly concerned to celebrate the centenary town's incorporation as a borough, in 1986. The Association has become a source of advice and support on several issues, such as pedestrian- isation of the town centre, the listing and conservation of important local buildings.
